comments:
I tested this with the embedded browser example. go to page which has a form
submnitted using a javascript submit(). When you try to do it, it won't work.
Haven't tested it with a form submitted without javascript. One guess might be
that Mozilla is trying to display dialog if I want to remember the values and
this dialog will be displayed.

Also when the page contains javascript alerts (e.g. window.alert("..")) these
will not be displayed.

Also print dialog displayed with window.print() doesn't work. Sorry I have found
few similar bugs to this, but none of them summarizes the problem. The problem
really is that SWT doesn't support when Mozilla wants to display some window
which is causing all kinds of problems.

Miroslav:
Can you download the latest SWT and Example Plug-Ins - the Example Plug-Ins 
(on the Eclipse download page) includes the SWT examples. In particular, it 
contains the org.eclipse.swt.examples.browser.BrowserExample.

When you run this BrowserExample, does the window.print work? It does for me.
How are your other cases doing?

Thanks

I have tried it with 3.0M6 on Fedora Core 1 with Mozilla upgraded using RPMs 
for Fedora Core1 downloadable from mozilla.org. Is there a newer version of 
swt? I am going to try it with the snippet again (I though I already did that).

This is my status. I cannot run build M6 on my installation of Fedora Core 1 
(an non root) because of following error

1. The bring up the browser
You cannot submit form in this browser. THerefore I open normal mozilla, go to 
mapquest to display some address and then select print link. On the page I get 
is link send to printer which brings the Print dialog. In mozilla it works 
fine. I copy the link to the SWT embedded browser. The page loads but when I 
click on the Send to printer link, it doesn't do anything.

2. The render HTML with relative link.
I modified the link to include onclick="window.print();" When I click on the 
link the print dialog doesn't show and I just get the eclipse page.

Therefore it doesn't work for me.
